content: quote: TITLE: Obama Drops Controversial Third-Party Billing Proposal for Veterans President Obama today abandoned a proposal to bill veterans' private insurance companies for treatment of combat-related injuries after the measure prompted an outcry from veterans service organizations and members of Congress. . . Sen. Patty Murray (D-Wash.), a senior member of the Veterans' Affairs and Budget committees who warned VA Secretary Eric K. Shinseki last week that Obama's third-party billing proposal would be "dead on arrival," issued a statement saying the president "did the right thing in dropping this proposal. <more> "http://voices.washingtonpost.com/44/2009/03/18/obama_drops_controversial_thir.html?wprss=44" This is good news ... regardless of why he elected to drop it. I must confess, I find Gibbs' statement a bit suspect: quote: "In considering the third party billing issue, the administration was seeking to maximize the resources available for veterans," Gibbs said. "However, the president listened to concerns raised by the [veterans service organizations] that this might, under certain circumstances, affect veterans and their families' ability to access health care." How 3d party billing could possibly "maximize" the resouces available for veterans defies common sense. My own personal opinion based on comments made by a number of Democratic senators is that it became clear to him that this dog don't hunt - in the words of Patty Murray ... DOA.

"However, the president listened to concerns raised by the [veterans service organizations] that this might, under certain circumstances, affect veterans and their families' ability to access health care." How 3d party billing could possibly "maximize" the resouces available for veterans defies common sense. My own personal opinion based on comments made by a number of Democratic senators is that it became clear to him that this dog don't hunt - in the words of Patty Murray ... DOA.
title: POTUS 44 Drops Controversial Third-Party Billing Proposal for Vets

content: He got Scared, plain and simple. He realized the Public wasnt going to stand for that feculant proposal. The Fact that he even floated such a Proposal shows how pathetic he is.

title: POTUS 44 Drops Controversial Third-Party Billing Proposal for Vets
